title: Binary formats rendered as text by Chrome instead of a download prompt
body:
**Description**

I am creating a http file server with the `fs::FileServer`.
I use the edge browser to access a file and want to see if the file can be downloaded normally.
I tested `exe`, `iso`, `rar` files and found that `rar` files can be downloaded normally, and `exe` files and `iso` files are displayed in the browser as texture.
I tested `edge`, `chrome`,`firefox`  and found that `firefox` files can download these files normally,but chromium based browsers not.
I can download the `ChromeSetup.exe` from google with `edge` normally.

**To Reproduce**

main.rs
```rs
use structopt::StructOpt;
use rocket::fs::FileServer;
use rocket_cors::{Cors, AllowedOrigins, AllowedHeaders};

#[derive(StructOpt)]
struct Cli {
    root: String,
    port: i32,
}

pub fn rocket_cors_config() -> Cors {
	rocket_cors::CorsOptions {
		allowed_origins:AllowedOrigins::All,
		allowed_headers: AllowedHeaders::All,
		allow_credentials: true,
		..Default::default()
	}.to_cors().expect("Failed to create rocket cors options")
}

#[rocket::main]
async fn main() -> Result<(), rocket::Error> {
    let args = Cli::from_args();
    let root = args.root;
    let port = args.port;

    let figment = rocket::Config::figment().merge(("port", port));
    let _rocket = rocket::custom(figment)
        .mount("/file", FileServer::from(root))
        .attach(rocket_cors_config())
        .launch()
        .await?;
    Ok(())
}
```
Cargo.toml
```toml
[package]
name = "fsproxy"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"

# See more keys and their definitions at https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html

[dependencies]
rocket ="0.5.0-rc.3"
rocket_cors = "0.6.0-alpha2"
structopt = "0.3.26"

```

output
```
Configured for debug.
   >> address: 127.0.0.1
   >> port: 38001
   >> workers: 24
   >> max blocking threads: 512
   >> ident: Rocket
   >> IP header: X-Real-IP
   >> limits: bytes = 8KiB, data-form = 2MiB, file = 1MiB, form = 32KiB, json = 1MiB, msgpack = 1MiB, string = 8KiB
   >> temp dir: C:\Users\dell\AppData\Local\Temp\
   >> http/2: true
   >> keep-alive: 5s
   >> tls: disabled
   >> shutdown: ctrlc = true, force = true, grace = 2s, mercy = 3s
   >> log level: normal
   >> cli colors: true
Routes:
   >> (FileServer: C:/Users/dell/Downloads) GET /file/<path..> [10]
   >> GET /cors/<status>
Fairings:
   >> Shield (liftoff, response, singleton)
   >> CORS (ignite, request, response)
Shield:
   >> X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
   >> Permissions-Policy: interest-cohort=()
   >> X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
Rocket has launched from http://127.0.0.1:38001
GET /file/ChromeSetup.exe text/html:
   >> Matched: (FileServer: C:/Users/dell/Downloads) GET /file/<path..> [10]
   >> Outcome: Success
   >> Response succeeded.
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31911231/233848964-35d10e86-6d74-4362-9069-72d07f874f89.png)


**Environment:**

 - OS Distribution and Kernel: Windows11
 - Rocket Version:0.5.0-rc.3 or master@9b0564e
